Description: Ithyphallic terracotta figurine. Possibly Harpocrates. Naked figure carrying bag stands atop his curled phallus. Two-piece mould made, the mould join being tidied with a flat instrument. Probably locally made. Red-brown Nile silt with grey core. Abundant gold mica, organics, quartz and white inclusions. Head missing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.218) (Phase 3)
